text.author: Benjamin Gerber
text.title: Indie Talks Episode 16 - Phil McCoy, Jen Page, Ian Hubert and Project London
text.summary1: (human1) The team of Project London, a sci-fi film with tie-in products, talk about the experience of making the film, the tie-in graphic novel, the creative process, marketing the film at conventions, and the next steps for the team.
text.summary2: (claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022) Project London has two tie-in products (a graphic novel and novella) created by Branson Anderson and Caleb Wheeler, and the team plans to promote the film through conventions while working on other projects like Geekseekers, Gamers 3, and freelance work in 2013.
text.summary3: (gpt4o) Benjamin Gerber and Phil McCoy discuss Project London, highlighting the tie-in graphic novel and novella, detailing creative contributions from Branson Anderson and Caleb Wheeler, marketing strategies, and future plans for the project, as well as mentioning upcoming conventions and personal projects from team members like Jen Page and Ian Hubert for 2013.
text.summary4: (Meta-Llama-3-8B-Instruct) The podcast discusses the graphic novel and novella tie-ins for the movie Project London, featuring artists Branson Anderson and Caleb Wheeler, and discusses marketing plans for the film.
text.summary5: (Qwen2.5-7B-Instruct) The creator of Project London discusses the release of the graphic novel and novella tie-ins to the film, upcoming conventions, and future projects including Geekseekers, ChopSockyBoom, and personal short films.
